To the chief Musician for the sons of Korah, A Song upon Alamoth. God <FI>is<Fi> our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.<RF>for: or, of<Rf>
Therefore will not we fear, though the earth be removed, and though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea;<RF>midst…: Heb. heart of the seas<Rf>
<FI>Though<Fi> the waters thereof roar <FI>and<Fi> be troubled, <FI>though<Fi> the mountains shake with the swelling thereof. Selah.
<FI>There is<Fi> a river, the streams whereof shall make glad the city of God, the holy <FI>place<Fi> of the tabernacles of the most High.
God <FI>is<Fi> in the midst of her; she shall not be moved: God shall help her, <FI>and that<Fi> right early.<RF>and…: Heb. when the morning appeareth<Rf><CM>
The heathen raged, the kingdoms were moved: he uttered his voice, the earth melted.
The LORD of hosts <FI>is<Fi> with us; the God of Jacob <FI>is<Fi> our refuge. Selah.<RF>our…: Heb. an high place for us<Rf>
Come, behold the works of the LORD, what desolations he hath made in the earth.
He maketh wars to cease unto the end of the earth; he breaketh the bow, and cutteth the spear in sunder; he burneth the chariot in the fire.
Be still, and know that I <FI>am<Fi> God: I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth.
The LORD of hosts <FI>is<Fi> with us; the God of Jacob <FI>is<Fi> our refuge. Selah.<CM>
